title: Permaban

replies.body: You only get banned right after your 14 day ban if you are toxic immediately. So they told you in the email, last warning, and you ignored it.

Yeah I didn't get the e-mail. I only knew I was banned and when I was going to get unbanned by what it said when i tried to log on. It's still bullshit regardless to perma ban someone for talking shit. It's a damn video game. People have been having fun talking shit since Ultima Online in the 90s. The amount of money someone spends on their account should have a huge say in it to.. since League of Legends wouldn't even update the way that they do if it wasn't for people like me who supported the game so much for so long. I've played league since season 1 and have supported it with quite a lot of money. I got the icons you get for buying RP without even knowing about them.

> BAM perma ban first game back after 14 day suspension LOL. GGNORE league

Uhh yea, everyone already knew this since like what, 2 years ago? Keep yourself updated at all times before you get yourself in trouble such as this.

People are not inherently toxic. If they are, they at least have the common decency to hide it and be respectful or a semblance thereof in public. People who aren't respectful in public either get their teeth kicked in or worse. Your argument falls flat in that regard, because people do not tolerate shit talking in the real world, even in the middle ages that you bring up; the shit talking that is tolerated at sporting events doesn't even come remotely close to the vile spew I see from some players in this game.

You clearly disregarded the punishments you received and that's why you lost your account. You knew this. Everyone knows this. It's not some big secret that if you continue to be toxic after a punishment, you will get punished again.

Having a hard life doesn't make it right to take it out on others in real life or online. Honestly its pretty unhealthy, you should be looking for moments where you can healthily socialize with others, not trying to bring them down to your level.

If you really feel like you need to take your pent up aggression out on something, find a single player game or something.

I mean it's good advice... but right there in what you say "you should be looking for moments where you can healthily socialize with others" ... you know I wish I could. But mental disorder is something that is very real in my life. It's hard for a person like me to be good natured all the time, and socializing is weak in me.
